thread.title: Baby thrown from window in the Bronx, cops say
thread.title_full: Baby thrown from window in the Bronx, cops say - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Baby thrown from window in the Bronx, cops say
text:
Google Maps Cops say a baby was thrown from a window in this Tiebout Ave. building Thursday. A baby was thrown from an apartment window in the Bronx Thursday, police sources said.
The unidentified infant was tossed out of the window on Tiebout Ave. near E. 182nd St. in Fordham at about 1:30 p.m., officials said.
A frantic 911 caller reported the terrible incident.
Paramedics rushed the infant, who was in cardiac arrest, to St. Barnabas Hospital, officials said. The babyâ€™s name was not immediately disclosed.
The incident took place just two and a half weeks after 33-year-old Jennifer Berry was arrested for throwing her newborn out a window on W. 183rd St. in University Heights, officials said.
Berry allegedly threw the baby out the window moments after the child was born, officials said.
ttracy@nydailynews.com
